XRDepthInformation.summary: NOTE Experimental The XRDepthInformation interface contains information about the distance from the user's device to the real-world geometry in the user's environment.

remarks.para: This interface is the parent of:
You will usually interact with these child interfaces. However, XRDepthInformation provides some useful properties that are inherited:

XRDepthInformationHeight.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only height property of the interface contains the height of the depth buffer (number of rows).

XRDepthInformationNormDepthBufferFromNor.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only normDepthBufferFromNormView property of the interface contains the 3D geometric transform that needs to be applied when indexing into the depth buffer.
XRDepthInformationNormDepthBufferFromNor.value: An that needs to be applied when indexing into the depth buffer. The transformation that the matrix represents changes the coordinate system from normalized view coordinates to normalized depth-buffer coordinates that can then be scaled by depth buffer's width and height to obtain the absolute depth buffer coordinates.

XRDepthInformationRawValueToMeters.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only rawValueToMeters property of the interface contains the scale factor by which the raw depth values must be multiplied in order to get the depths in meters.

remarks.para: For CPU depth information, see also the method.

XRDepthInformationWidth.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only width property of the interface contains the width of the depth buffer (number of columns).
